photo.description: View On Black About The Senado Square, or Senate Square (Portuguese: Largo do Senado; traditional Chinese: 議事亭前地), is a paved area in the centre of the former Portuguese colony of Macau, enclosed by the buildings of the Leal Senado, the General Post Office, and St. Dominic’s Church. The square is paved in the traditional Portuguese pavement. It is part of the UNESCO World Heritage Site "Historic Centre of Macau". Tip for the traveller: DO NOT attempt to enter Macau on 19th December, 1 day before establishment day and just 6 days before Christmas. Doing so will earn you an hour's wait at the customs and you would have to deal with tons of Chinese tourists who are just rude and obnoxious.
photo.tags: hdr macau borderfx largodosenado largo square central center city china establishment day celebration christmas lights
photo.title: Largo do Senado, Macau HDR
